question: 41. You want to provide Internet access for an instance in a non-default subnet. What do you need to do? (Choose two.)
options: D. Attach a NAT instance to the subnet.
C. Attach an internet gateway to the VPC in which the subnet resides.
B. Assign a public IP address to the instance.
A. Assign a private IP address to the instance.
answers: C. Attach an internet gateway to the VPC in which the subnet resides.
B. Assign a public IP address to the instance.

question: 42. What technology can you use to provide single sign-on to the AWS management console?
43. You have created a new user in IAM. What default permissions does that user have?
options: A. Read access to all AWS services
B. Read and write access to all AWS services
C. No access to any AWS services
D. Read access only to the IAM service
answers: C. No access to any AWS services

question: 45. You have created a new IAM user and created their sign-in URL. You give the user their URL. What else will they need to log in to the AWS management console? (Choose two.)
46. Which of the following IAM groups will allow users within it to interact with all AWS services?
options: C. The default IAM permissions provide this level of access.

question: 47. You have created a new IAM user and given the credentials to the user. However, she still is unable to log in to the AWS management console. What might the problem be?
options: A. You have not enabled Multi-Factor Authentication.
C. You have not provided the user her access key ID.
D. You have not provided the user her customized sign-in link.
B. You have not enabled the User Login policy.
answers: D. You have not provided the user her customized sign-in link.

question: 48. You have been tasked with building an application that provides backend servicing for a mobile game with millions of users. Which of the following services might you use to receive and process the messages that the mobile clients send?
49. Which of the following is required to set up a new AWS account for a company new to AWS?
50. Which of the following AWS-defined IAM policies offer read and write access to the S3 and EC2 services? (Choose two.)
51. What does AWS call a document that defines a set of one or more permissions?
52. What does the AWS service abbreviated as ECS stand for?
53. Which of the following are advantages of using containers for applications in AWS compared to using EC2 instances? (Choose two.)
options: C. You can reduce the startup time of applications.
A. You can scale applications automatically.
D. You can avoid having to explicitly manage and provision servers.
B. You can run larger applications in a container.
answers: D. You can avoid having to explicitly manage and provision servers.
C. You can reduce the startup time of applications.

question: 54. Which of the following sets of services are used in a typical AWS container stack?
55. Which of the following services is typically associated with ECS?
56. Which of the following are good reasons to consider using containers in AWS for your applications? (Choose two.)
options: B. You want to more effectively use your existing compute instances.
C. You have limited resources for managing your existing EC2 instances.
D. You need to scale up and down your applications.
A. You want to reduce overall cost.
answers: B. You want to more effectively use your existing compute instances.
C. You have limited resources for managing your existing EC2 instances.

question: 57. Which of the following are differences between container-based applications and Lambda-based ones? (Choose two.)
options: D. Containers can run entire application stacks; Lambda can only run isolated chunks of code.
B. Containers live on underlying compute instances; Lambda code does not.
A. Containers scale based on load and usage; Lambda scales based on events.
C. Containers are not as highly scalable as Lambda.
answers: A. Containers scale based on load and usage; Lambda scales based on events.
D. Containers can run entire application stacks; Lambda can only run isolated chunks of code.
